pullrequest.title: Added deprecation warning prints extending pull request #2622

content.raw:
1. Oh, then I misunderstood what you meant. I thought additional warnings should be printed since the call to the functions has been commented out. Should this be targeted at gazebo 8, or at all versions preceding gazebo 9?
2. Same misunderstanding as (1): Thought that it should warn the user who doesn't pay too much attention to compiler warnings. Can add the additional info, after we clarify which branch(es) this should be targeted at.
3. They call Link::SetLinearAccel()/Link::SetAngularAccel() so I though printing two warnings is maybe a bit much. Can add it to model as well of course.

Anybody else, additional thoughts on this?
content.html:
1. Oh, then I misunderstood what you meant. I thought additional warnings should be printed since the call to the functions has been commented out. Should this be targeted at gazebo 8, or at all versions preceding gazebo 9?
  2. Same misunderstanding as (1): Thought that it should warn the user who doesn't pay too much attention to compiler warnings. Can add the additional info, after we clarify which branch(es) this should be targeted at.
  3. They call Link::SetLinearAccel()/Link::SetAngularAccel() so I though printing two warnings is maybe a bit much. Can add it to model as well of course.

Anybody else, additional thoughts on this?
